FuncDef:
The redirect ip-nexthop command configures traffic redirection for the service chain instance.
The undo redirect ip-nexthop command deletes traffic redirection of the service chain instance.
By default, traffic redirection of the service chain instance is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates redirection of the traffic from the private network to the public network.
-

Indicates redirection of the traffic from the public network to the private network.
-

Specifies the next-hop IPv4 address for redirection.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the traffic that passes the service chain does not meet requirements of policy-based routing, to redirect the traffic that passes the service chain, run the redirect ip-nexthop command in the service chain instance to
specify the traffic direction.
Prerequisites
The service chain instance has been created.
Precautions
Only redirection on one direction can be configured in the service chain instance, and only one configuration record is supported.If the NAT service is not the last hop on the direction, NAT redirection cannot be configured.If redirection is configured for the service chain instance, redirection cannot be configured for the NAT instance.
